name: AfterSales
description: SaaS designed for one of my clients to make the post-sales process easier to manage. It has been made available on all devices by making both a web and a native application.
It's equipped with an administator panel, staff profiles with permissions, billing follow-up, file follow-up, client-shareable file dashboard, attachments support, e-mail server, ...
Some technical difficulties have been encountered to lower the infrastructure cost of the project. Hence, the e-mail server had to be made from scratch to run on-premise.
Originally, the database was made to run on-premise too. But due to too high maintenance costs, it has been moved to Supabase Postgres Database and Edge Functions.
As of now, the source code and the access to the app are restricted by exclusivity contracts.

name: Bad Clients
description: SaaS designed to help freelancers spot bad proposals by leveraging AI and a Chrome extension for direct integration in Upwork
It is shipped with extension keys to connect easily the extension, tiered payment, and the OpenAI API to connect OpenRouter models.

name: EPICS
description: A command-line utility to find documentation about coding style issues at Epitech.

name: File sharing
description: File sharing tool working only over P2P networks.
This project is part of a vast plan I undertook to use as many decentralized web technologies as possible in my projects. The goal is to show my clients decentralized technologies are reliable.
To work reliably, the tool shares data by chunks and checksums on the receiving end by comparing the sum of the sending side with the sum calculated on the receiving side.

name: Hex Realm
description: Side-project made to render a procedurally generated 3D world.
Based on hexagons, this world generator aims to create visually pleasing 3D scenes. This project allows me to learn more about 3D rendering.
Since I faced issues with buffer overflows while rendering. I had to learn the hard way how GPU and rendering works.

name: Ju-Chat
description: I always wanted to develop and extend my expertise on alt systems to make already widely used services better.
This web-app, alongside P2P-File-Sharing, represent a new stone to my willingness to make everything P2P.
With this app, you can chat privately and anonymously with anyone. Everything is saved locally (yes, you physically own your data)

name: Joogle Search
description: Joogle Search is a search engine I built to better understand scraping mechanisms, indexing, and fast data access.
Built upon Rocket.rs, it features full indexing with robots.txt and sitemaps support.
It also features a dashboard where domain owners can submit their website for indexation.

name: Mandelbrot
description: Mandelbrot set viewer made using Rust and Winit.
Originally made to run on CPU, this viewer was really laggy. The addition of chunks generation and the usage of shaders made it really efficient.
The hardest part of this project was to implement shaders. The addition of chunks generation is still under testing since it still needs a bit of tweaking...

name: OddsAssist
description: OddsAsssist is a betting assistance platform that aims at making betters more skilled
I took part in building the v2 of this product by developing the UI and some API routes of the project

name: Tic-Tac-Toe
description: Tic-Tac-Toe playable single or in multiplayer mode.
This project is part of a vast plan I undertook to use as many decentralized web technologies as possible in my projects. The goal is to show my clients decentralized technologies are reliable.
This Tic-Tac-Toe relies on a relayed P2P network to work on multiplayer mode. However, due to Apple's privacy policies Apple devices may fail to connect to the network.
